Articles.Content:
Hi!

For my first MOD I'm honored to present you this: the Nagging Nadia (Kerman). It adds altitude callouts when landings, as well as an "Over G" and the famous "Duit Duit! Pull Up!" that somes (including me) will hear very often if they install it.

"Nagging Nadia" is the new name of the Addon, as it is far better than "GPWS" (thanks to p1t1o for the awesome idea!)

This is a partless and GUI-less addon for KSP that I made, so no pics (because you can't represent sound in pictures!), it activates itself when you start the flight. Just install and enjoy

DOWNLOAD | Back up download + source and patches

Be aware that it is still in beta state; bugs needs to be found and removed, things needs to be tweaked, features needs to be added.

Installation

- Go to the download link

- Extract everything into your KSP folder (like any mod)

Patching

Warning! Be aware that patching may introduce more bugs as the content has not been fully tested yet. It is here for people who wants the very lastest version and wants to help me finding bugs.

- Go to the download link

- Go into the "patches" folder

- Download everything from there

- Install in your KSP copy following the folder structure.

Source is in the "source" folder, updated each time I save the project.

In the last version:

- Altitude callouts

- Dynamic Over G warning (the longest you get forces, the less "tolerant" it gets

- Pull Up warning

To do :

- Overheat warning

- GPWS for docking

- Gear alert if landing gears present and not opened

- "Variometer-like altimeter" for probes and landers: More suitable for rockets and landers, it will play a sound that will pitch the closer you get from the terrain

- Destruction alarm (when the craft is ripped apart or things explode)

If you find bugs, if you have ideas for the plugin, tell me them ! I'll be happy to implement (if possible) them !

Hope you enjoy it!

The Audible Cockpit Warning System AWS2! I remember that, it was great. Nice to see someone remaking this. ^^

The real voice of McDonnell Douglas GPWS:

I used a speech synthetiser to create the voice then I pitched them (I used an Audacity preset, 33 to 45 "turns"(?) disc pitchover) to sound more natural. I could have recorded them in spanish and reverse them, but I wanted them to be understandable, so here they are.

By the way, video's online on the OP !

There are still quite a few things that is unperfect, but it is time for an official update as the Pull Up bug is definitely annoying.

Basically, it was the fact that the terrain unloads as you get high enough, but doesn't necessarily returns "-1", so my code got confused and thinked that you were below 400m, and it was time to check vertical speed. Well, as no orbits are perfect, there was a time when you vertical speed dropped below -5 m/s (the max vert speed allowed at 0m over terrain) and things went weird. Now it is fixed and hopefully you should not have to worry about it anymore.

Another thing that got ameliorated is the volume management. It is still bound to the Voice Volume on the Sounds Settings, but it now detects a change in the slider volume and updates the sound volumes accordingly. So you can just go to the ingame settings menu instead of quit everything and have to go to the main menu settings.

So yeah, no new awesome features yet, still a nice updates with some bugs fixed.

Plus, now I think the mod evolved into a state where it can go to the SpacePort ! This is now the primary downloading source. Source code is still on the Google Drive folder, if you want to look at it.
